TypeSignature.Value: public sealed class Configuration : Java.Lang.Object, Android.OS.IParcelable, IDisposable, Java.Lang.IComparable

.class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit Configuration extends Java.Lang.Object implements class Android.OS.IParcelable, class Android.Runtime.IJavaObject, class Java.Lang.IComparable, class System.IDisposable

Docs.summary: This class describes all device configuration information that can impact the resources the application retrieves.

remarks.para: This class describes all device configuration information that can impact the resources the application retrieves. This includes both user-specified configuration options (locale and scaling) as well as device configurations (such as input modes, screen size and screen orientation). Configuration config = getResources().getConfiguration();
You can acquire this object from , using . Thus, from an activity, you can get it by chaining the request with :

Docs.summary: A flag indicating whether any keyboard is available.

remarks.para: A flag indicating whether any keyboard is available. Unlike , this also takes into account a soft keyboard, so if the hard keyboard is hidden but there is soft keyboard available, it will be set to NO. Value is one of: , .

Docs.summary: IMSI MNC (Mobile Network Code), corresponding to mnc resource qualifier. 0 if undefined.

remarks.para: IMSI MNC (Mobile Network Code), corresponding to mnc resource qualifier. 0 if undefined. Note that the actual MNC may be 0; in order to check for this use the symbol.

Docs.summary: Constant used to to represent MNC (Mobile Network Code) zero. 0 cannot be used, since it is used to represent an undefined MNC.

Docs.summary: Bit mask of overall layout of the screen.

remarks.para: Bit mask of overall layout of the screen. Currently there are two fields:
The bits define the overall size of the screen. They may be one of , , , or .
The defines whether the screen is wider/taller than normal. They may be one of or .
The defines whether the screen layout is either LTR or RTL. They may be one of or .
See Supporting Multiple Screens for more information.

Docs.summary: The smallest screen size an application will see in normal operation, corresponding to smallest screen width resource qualifier.

remarks.para: The smallest screen size an application will see in normal operation, corresponding to smallest screen width resource qualifier. This is the smallest value of both screenWidthDp and screenHeightDp in both portrait and landscape. Set to if no width is specified.

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
